wikipedia_page.main: Kevin Stonehouse (20 September 1959 – 28 July 2019) was an English professional footballer who played as a striker for Shildon (two spells), Blackburn Rovers, Huddersfield Town, Blackpool, Darlington, Carlisle United, Rochdale and Bishop Auckland.He later worked for Darlington in roles including that of Football in the Community officer and for Newcastle United as a scout.Stonehouse died on 28 July 2019 at the age of 59.
